New Records: Argentina won a record 16th Copa América title.
Argentina surpassed Uruguay for the most Copa América titles.
Argentina won their third straight major title following the 2021 Copa América and 2022 World Cup.
Argentina matched Spain, who won the 2008 and 2012 European Championships around the 2010 World Cup.
Argentina stopped Colombia's 28-game unbeaten streak dating to a February 2022 loss to Argentina.
Key Match Events: Lautaro Martínez scored a late extra-time goal in the 112th minute to secure the victory for Argentina.
Lionel Messi suffered a noncontact injury in the 64th minute and had to leave the match.
The match started over 75 minutes late due to crowd trouble at Hard Rock Stadium.
Nicolás Tagliafico's goal in the 75th minute was ruled offside.
Nicolas Gonzalez, who replaced Messi, was stopped by Vargas in the 95th minute.
Numerous players lost their footing during the second half due to heavily watered grass following the half-time performance by Shakira.
Post-Match Reflections: Angel Di Maria reflected on his final Argentina match, expressing gratitude and joy for retiring with a title.
Di Maria and Otamendi are set to end their international careers.
Di Maria commented on Messi's injury and the team's ability to give him joy despite his early exit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The start of the match was delayed due to crowd control issues, including fans breaching security gates.
The match was held at Miami's Hard Rock Stadium, which will be used for the 2026 World Cup.
The grass was heavily watered with sprinklers following the half-time performance by Colombian pop star Shakira, causing an extended half-time break.
